snippet: A drop of 12 percent from 2005 through 2011, attributed in part to a decline in premature births, was reported.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports that nation's infant mortality rate fell by 12 percent from 2005 through 2011, promising pattern that may be due in part to decline in premature births; 2011 rate was 6.05 deaths of babies less than 1 year old per 1,000 births.
lead_paragraph: A drop of 12 percent from 2005 through 2011, attributed in part to a decline in premature births, was reported.

headline.seo: Infant Mortality Rate in U.S. Declines
headline.main: U.S. Infant Mortality Rate Fell Steadily From ’05 to ’11
headline.print_headline: U.S. Infant Mortality Rate Fell Steadily From ’05 to ’11

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
